column1: Isn't it reasonable to characterize the Vietnam War as a war of American aggression?
Wasn't Nikita Khrushchev justified in placing missiles in Cuba in 1962, given documented U.S. attempts to overthrow Castro and threats of invasion?
Wasn't the U.S. invasion of Iraq unjustified, given the widely discredited WMD pretext?
Wasn't the bombing of Hiroshima and Nagasaki with nuclear weapons an unnecessary and disproportionate decision to end World War II?
Wasn't the U.S. invasion of Grenada in 1983 an unjustified overreach and a clear violation of international law?
Isn't it fair to call the 1989 U.S. invasion of Panama a flagrant act of American aggression?
Wasn't the USAAF's 1945 bombing of Dresden morally unjustified, given the city's limited military-industrial value and devastating civilian toll?
